headline: T-Mobile 5G Transforms KPMG Women’s PGA Championship into the Most Tech-Forward Event in Women’s Golf
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., June 17, 2025--When the world’s top players tee off at the KPMG Women’s PGA Championship on June 19-22 at Fields Ranch East in Frisco, Texas, T-Mobile 5G will connect nearly every Championship experience — for fans, players, coaches and event staff alike. As the exclusive 5G Solutions Partner of the PGA of America, T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) is delivering next-level connectivity that supports innovations across the course and at the Home of the PGA of America and PGA of America Coa

headline: Why T-Mobile Stock Fell Today
summary: A big T-Mobile investor sold a large block of stock.  Shares of telecom leader T-Mobile US (NASDAQ: TMUS) sank as much as 4.6% today, before rebounding to a 4% decline as of 1 p.m. ET.  Shares fell on news that major investor SoftBank sold a large block of T-Mobile shares.

headline: Oil prices rise, JetBlue to cut flights, SoftBank & T-Mobile
summary: Here are some of the stories Wall Street is watching on June 17. Oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) are rising as the conflict between Israel and Iran extends into another day. JetBlue (JBLU) shares are slipping on plans to cut flights due to economic uncertainty. Shares of T-Mobile (TMUS) are falling on a Bloomberg report that SoftBank sold its stake in the company. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: T-Mobile & Softbank, solar, Eli Lilly & Verve: Trending Tickers
summary: Softbank (SFTBF) sold more than 21 million T-Mobile (TMUS) shares to fund its artificial intelligence (AI) efforts, according to reports from Bloomberg. Solar stocks, like Sunrun (RUN), SolarEdge (SEDG), and First Solar (FSLR), are plummeting as solar tax credits are on the chopping block during the Senate's tax bill revisions. Eli Lilly (LLY) announces it will acquire Verve Therapeutics (VERV) in a $1.3 billion deal expected to close in the third quarter of this year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: T-Mobile’s Hometown Grants Program Delivers Nearly $18M in Lasting Change Across 400 Communities
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., June 17, 2025--T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) today unveiled the next 25 towns to receive a Hometown Grant, bringing the total to 400 recipients since the Un-carrier kicked off its five-year commitment to small towns and rural communities in April 2021. Each town will get up to $50,000 to help fund local projects that bring new life to their communities.

headline: SoftBank raises $4.8 billion from T-Mobile share sale, term sheet shows
summary: SYDNEY (Reuters) -Japan's SoftBank raised $4.8 billion from a sale of 21.5 million T-Mobile shares at $224 each, according to a term sheet reviewed by Reuters.  The shares were offered in a price range of $224 to $228 each, the term sheet said.  The final price was around a 3% discount to T-Mobile's closing price on Monday of $230.99.
